alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 13 at 3:20AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the SALINAS RIVER...including Bradley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue as the Salinas River slowly recedes. Impacts will persist well after the river has dropped below the official flood stage. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 14 ft, Minor lowland flooding is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM PST Monday, March 13 the stage was 13.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM PST Monday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to stay in monitor stage through Tuesday before it is forecast to rise once again above flood stage late Tuesday in response to the next atmospheric river that will impact the region Tuesday. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1030 AM PDT.
